result.execSummary:
The defendant Enrique A Palmore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Supervision Fees.
-Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE,
-Court ordered Defendant to pay MANDATORY COSTS/FEES, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court Waived Non-Mandatory COSTS/FEES.
-Court set Restitution at ZERO.

Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
If defendant successfully completes the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program Court will release Defendant within 30 days of notification. Remaining Initial Confinement time will be converted to extended supervision.
*8/12/2022  Honorable Jean Marie Kies signed Order.  Amended to include a total of 72 days of sentence credit.*
Concurrent to Waukesha Case 21CF615 , with credit for 125 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Obtain/Maintain Full-Time Employment or Full-Time Enrollment in School, or combination of both.

- No New Law Violation raising to the level of Probable Cause.
- No Contact with T.A.X, Residence or their Family.
No contact with firearms.

- Cooperate with Probation Agent.
- Mental Health Evaluation, comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications.
- Treatment and counseling programs, as determined by DOC Agent.
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
- Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
- Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Enrique A Palmore

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed and filed  on 8/12/2022 which states "the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 72 days of sentence credit.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jean Kies, Br. 45, for review. mag

Defendant Enrique A Palmore in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Enrique A Palmore in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. Additional Statements made by A.G.

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of FOUR (4) YEARS, Concurrent to Waukesha Case 21CF615 , with credit for 125 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is TWO (2) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  

Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
 
If defendant successfully completes the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program Court will release Defendant within 30 days of notification. Remaining Initial Confinement time will be converted to extended supervision.

EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No New Law Violation raising to the level of Probable Cause.
- Cooperate with Probation Agent.
- Mental Health Evaluation, comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications. 
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Treatment and counseling programs, as determined by DOC Agent. 
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Obtain/Maintain Full-Time Employment or Full-Time Enrollment in School, or combination of both.
- No Contact with T.A.X, Residence or their Family.
- No Contact with Firearms.
-Supervision Fees

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE,
Court ordered Defendant to pay MANDATORY COSTS/FEES, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court Waived Non-Mandatory COSTS/FEES, .

Court set Restitution at ZERO.

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Enrique A Palmore in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Enrique A Palmore in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the  Information  and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
Request for Prompt Disposition - expires 10/3/22 provided by the State

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Enrique A Palmore not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Enrique A Palmore in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Enrique A Palmore in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Enrique A Palmore not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AAX

Defendant Enrique A Palmore in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Enrique A Palmore in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique A Palmore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
